books.title: The League of the Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: Hunting for Hidden Gold
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Two boy sleuths unravel a mystery about stolen gold.

books.title: Geronimo’s Story of His Life
books.author: Geronimo
books.summary: The Apache war chief Geronimo recounts the story of his life.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Understood Betsy
books.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher
books.summary: A young girl discovers independence, responsibility, and newfound confidence after being sent to live in a farmhouse with her extended family.

books.title: Indiscretions of Archie
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Englishman Archie Moffam makes a complaint about his room to the owner of the New York hotel, his life is changed forever.

books.title: Henry IV, Part II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The rebel forces plan another assault against King Henry’s forces after losing at the Battle of Shrewsbury.

books.title: The Wonderful Visit
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An angel falls into the everyday world of 19th Century England and is bewildered and despirited by human life and society.

books.title: Notes from Underground
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: A man living alone in St. Petersburg writes memoirs describing his alienation from modern society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: Murder in the Gunroom
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A private detective is called upon to evaluate a gun collection that contains a dark secret.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: Meditations
books.author: Marcus Aurelius
books.summary: The personal diary of the Roman Emperor, in which he lays out his thoughts and philosophical musings on the Stoic philosophy and way of life.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Fernando Pessoa
books.summary: A collection of Fernando Pessoa’s poetry.

books.title: The Indiscreet Jewels
books.author: Denis Diderot
books.summary: The Sultan of the Congo brings about philosophical inquiry and scandal when he is granted a magical ring that permits him to compel speech from the vaginas of the women of his court.

books.title: The Night Land
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: A 17th-century gentleman is reincarnated on a far-future Earth where the sun has died, and scours the hellish landscape for his lost love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: Six classic science fiction short stories by Stanley Weinbaum.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
